results.title: Structure within the image
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, CBS, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.) and Coast Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
Photographers Barbara Kasten and Garry Winogrand show how every photographer uses a unique structure within their work. Discusses framing, line, shape, tone and pattern and demonstrates ways to structurally improve photographs.

results.title: Reading photographs
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, CBS, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.) and Coast Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
The works of specific photographers are examined to illustrate that visual communication carries more emotional, political and cultural impact than verbal communication. Warns the viewer to be aware of various visual stimuli.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sandra Ostertag, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, CBS, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.) and Coast Community Colleges

results.title: The Film
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, CBS, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.) and Coast Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
Explores the factors to be considered when selecting film for a specific photographic situation. Commercial photographer, Jim Wood, discusses the process of choosing the most appropriate film for an assignment. Explains how the speed of a film determines its graininess, contrast, suitability for action shots, and sensitivity to various lighting conditions.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sandra Ostertag, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, CBS, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.) and Coast Community Colleges

results.title: Controlling exposure
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, CBS, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.) and Coast Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
Designed to help students become more aware of the qualities and effects of available light. Jack Welpott shows various indoor and outdoor settings and describes the way he responds to specific lighting conditions. Explores the emotional and aesthetic effects of light together with the technical aspects.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sandra Ostertag, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, CBS, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.) and Coast Community Colleges

results.title: Responding to light
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, CBS, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.) and Coast Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
Comments from well-known photographers and illustrations of their work center around the topic of the art and craft of manipulating light in the camera. Examines the effect of shutter, aperture, and camera pans. Photographers John Divola and Linda Connor discuss their work and how they use the technical aspects of photography to achieve creative effects.

results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
Demonstrates the technical differences between human and camera vision, and discusses the personal vision of the photographer. Eileen Cowin and Grant Mudford describe and demonstrate their approaches to photographic interpretation.

results.title: The Camera
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, CBS, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.) and Coast Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
Photographic artist and educator Mark Johnstone uses a view camera to demonstrate and describe basic features common to all cameras. Illustrates the advantages and disadvantages of various types of cameras. Guest photographers explain how their particular cameras are ideal for their types of photography.

results.title: A Visual heritage
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, CBS, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.) and Coast Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
Traces the highlights of the history of photography. Includes the pioneering work of Louis Daguerre and Nicephore Niepce which enabled the world to see itself objectively for the first time. This program features a number of historical photographs and a discussion of early photography by experts in the field.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sandra Ostertag, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, CBS, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.) and Coast Community Colleges

results.title: Image and Impact
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, CBS, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.) and Coast Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
Introduces the philosophy of this 20 part course which previews program guests and concepts to be taught over the series. Photographic vision is seen as a means of personal growth and individual expression.

results.creator_credit: Lynn John, John A. Givins and KTV Productions
results.brief_description: This series presented by Jay Laga’aia investigates the magic of TV and how it works. It provides practical advice on how people are making video stories and the techniques used by the professionals.
